Deploy KServe with llama.cpp runtime
description:
Deploy KServe with custom llama.cpp runtime for LLM inference on AMD Strix Halo.

## Research Findings (Dec 2025)

### Current Versions
| Component | Version | Notes |
|-----------|---------|-------|
| KServe | v0.16.0 | CNCF Incubating (Nov 2025) |
| Gateway API | v1.2.1 | Recommended over Istio |
| Gateway API Inference Extension | v1.2.1 | GA (was alpha in ADR-003) |
| KEDA | 2.18+ | For LLM-specific autoscaling |

### Architecture (from ADR-003, updated)
1. **KServe Standard Mode** - Not Knative, uses raw Kubernetes Deployments
2. **Custom llama.cpp runtime** - GGUF format, ROCm 6.4+ for gfx1151
3. **Gateway API** - Already deployed (Cilium Gateway)
4. **Gateway API Inference Extension** - Now GA, provides InferencePool CRD
5. **KEDA** - Blocked on this issue (eh-ops-63k)

### Key Changes from Original ADR
- Gateway API Inference Extension is now GA (v1.2.1)
- KServe v0.16.0 adds LLMInferenceService controller
- AMD has official KServe integration (AIM - AMD Inference Microservice)

### llama.cpp Optimization for Strix Halo
From strixhalo-homelab research:
- Always use `--no-mmap` on ROCm (critical!)
- Use `-ngl 999` to offload all layers to GPU
- Enable Flash Attention with rocWMMA builds
- 85W power mode is sweet spot (memory-bandwidth limited)
- Docker images: kyuz0/amd-strix-halo-toolboxes

## Blocked By
- eh-ops-tgc: Enable AMD GPU on shadow node (kernel params, device plugin)

## Implementation Plan (after GPU ready)
1. Deploy KServe controller (HelmRelease)
2. Create ClusterServingRuntime for llama.cpp
3. Configure model storage PVC (NFS to shadow)
4. Deploy InferenceService for test model
5. Add ServiceMonitor for Prometheus metrics
6. (Optional) Gateway API Inference Extension for intelligent routing

## References
- ADR: /workspace/eh-ops-repo/docs/adr/003-kserve-llm-serving.md
- Example: /workspace/eh-ops-repo/docker/kserve-llamacpp/kserve-example.yaml
- strixhalo-homelab: https://github.com/deseven/strixhalo-homelab

title: Enable AMD GPU on shadow node (Strix Halo)
description:
Enable AMD Strix Halo GPU (Radeon 8060S / gfx1151) on shadow node for LLM inference workloads.

## Hardware
- CPU: AMD Ryzen AI MAX+ 395
- GPU: Radeon 8060S (gfx1151) integrated
- Memory: 128GB Unified Memory Architecture (UMA)
- ROCm target: gfx1151

## Requirements

### 1. Kernel Parameters (DONE in talconfig.yaml)
- `ttm.pages_limit=31457280` (120GB for GPU, leaves 8GB for system)
- `amd_iommu=off` (~6% faster GPU memory reads)

### 2. Talos Factory Image with ROCm (TODO)
Current image lacks ROCm drivers. Need to:
- Create factory image with AMDGPU/ROCm extensions
- Or use system extensions approach

### 3. AMD GPU Device Plugin (TODO)
Deploy to kubernetes/infrastructure/:
- AMD GPU device plugin DaemonSet
- Enables `amd.com/gpu` resource requests

### 4. Verification Steps
- [ ] Apply updated talconfig to shadow node
- [ ] Verify `/dev/dri/renderD128` is available
- [ ] Run `rocm-smi` or equivalent diagnostic
- [ ] Test llama.cpp inference with GPU offload

## References
- https://github.com/deseven/strixhalo-homelab
- ROCm 6.4.3+ has gfx1151 support
- Docker images: kyuz0/amd-strix-halo-toolboxes
